environment.GUI.views

Class Animated

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • environment.GUI.views.Animated
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimulatorView<Station>, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public final class Animated
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements SimulatorView<Station>
    The Animated class is a subclass of the JFrame which implements the SimulatorView interface.

    The Animated class is responsible for creating and displaying visual representations of the Station class. The Animation also works independently as the animator asynchronously displays the Station objects.

    The Animated also allows the simulation to be paused and the speed of which the animator displays the simulation can also be specified.

    The Animated class uses the singleton pattern to allow only one instance of the Animated to exist.

    Since:
    20/03/2017
    Version:
    25/04/2017
    Author:
    John_Berg, David_Wightman
    See Also:
    SimulatorView, Serialized Form

      static class  Animated.AnimationPanel
      The AnimationaPanel class is a subclass of the JPanel class which is designed for drawing visual representations of the Station objects.
      private class  Animated.TimeStamp
      The Animated.TimeStamp class is a container used for the Animation class to store Station objects and times.
      static interface  Animated.Visual
      The interface used to produce the visual representation of the Location.
      static class  Animated.Visualisation
      The Animated.Visualisation enumeration contains visual representations of objects to be displayed in the Animated.AnimationPanel.

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private Animated()
      Constructs a JFrame that holds a newly constructed Animated.AnimationPanel and provides a panel underneath with buttons and sliders to control the speed and state of the animation,It then uses methods from SimulatorView to allow the simulation to be represented with the user chosen values from UserInterface

    • Method Detail

      • control

        private void control()
        Control the execution of the animator by interrupted and suspending the Thread or resuming the Thread.

        Activated when the controlButton is clicked checks if the animator is interrupted and if so, then call the Thread.resume() method to allow the animator to continiue execution, otherwise interrupt the animator.

        Set the title of the controlButton to "Pause" or "Continue" depending on if the animator is running or interrupted respectively.

        See Also:
        animator, controlButton, Thread, JButton

      • getInstance

        public static final Animated getInstance()
        Get the singleton instance of the Animated class.

        If the animated is null then initialise a new instance of Animated before returning it.

        Lazy initialisation.

        Returns:
        The animated single instance of Animated.
